page.title: 07RARE PLANTS
page.content:
There are areas of{heathland}which are{unique.Rare plants}grow here because the conditions are suitable. The serpentine helps keep the ground moist,the climate is warm,wet and windy and there are few frosts in winter.At least{15}of{Britain's}rarest plants grow in the area and maybe the plant's only British habitat.
{Cornish Heath , Large Lizard Clover, {Twin Flowered Clover Upright Clover, {Pygmy Rush,Pillwort,Land Quillwort}and {Three-lobed Water Crowfoot}are some of the plants that are only to be found in this area and{nowhere else in the {British Isle.} This area is of great interest to botanists from all over the world but there is considerable concern by {conservation}groups that the plants are under{threat}by man's use of land.
